Author: 21 August 2005
Review: Overall this was an excellent film, on par with Saving Private Ryan and Band of Brothers...
Review_Url: This film had to be one of the best cinematic experiences I've had with war movies,even though I watched it in my own home. The actors do magnificent portrayals of Hitler and his adjutants, not only showing you the horrors that they have committed, but the fact that they were people too, not just a stereotypical bad guy tying a girl to a train track. Bruno Ganz does a wonderful job at being Hitler, his compelling performance made you understand what it was that had so many people enthralled with the man, his charisma, his energy, and how he managed to make everything seem as though it were in control, even though the Russians were mere kilometers from the city center in the beginning of the movie. Ganz also shows the darker side of Hitler, his absurd ideals, his unreasonable strategies, and how mentally unstable he was by the end of the war. The film undoubtedly is dark, showing you over ten suicides, including those of mere children in the Hitler Youth, a girl a few years older than myself, perhaps 16, and a boy around 17. You also see the Hitlers', the Goebbles', their children's, and several lieutenants' suicides. The Downfall shows the chaos that ensued during and after the fall of the Reich, SS squads killing people who they had deemed traitors, those who had allegedly helped the Russians, and the horror of the war in itself. Traudle Junge's part and the young Hitler Youth boy, Peter, tend to be overshadowed by Hitler and his adjutants, but they do play a fairly large part. Overall, this movie was one of the best I have ever seen, morbidly fascinating and darkly compelling, a definite ten out of ten!

Author: 1 May 2012
Review_Url: Good film. No demons, just people and their deeds. Especially good, when You know history a little. Know what these beautiful persons done. And why. And how other beautiful people move them on their way to hell. "No more 1918!". No more, for sure. Next should be film, where Hitler with nazi pull Germany from the knees. And it will be true. And finally the film, how Germany find itself on such knees after WW1. Or maybe film about poor Poland... in 1938 Chezh...

Author: 21 December 2021
Review: The best foreign film that I have ever seen.
Review_Url: This movie is fantastic, and even though you have to read subtitles, it's totally worth it. It's great to see the last days of the mass murdering lunatic that was Hitler. I would recommend this to anyone with interest in world war 2 and Nazi Germany.

Author: 16 July 2013
Review: One of the two best non action World War 2 movie
Review_Url: One of the two best non action movies made about World War 2:) Hitler's final days in his underground bunker when Berlin is falling to Russians :) you never feel tragic as Hitler is the person whom anyone would hate . One tragic scene in the movie was a mother killing her five children as she didn't want them to live in a Germany without National Socialism (Nazism) :X :X pathetic ba**** ... there are more such pathetic creatures among Hitler followers .. even Hitler himself orders destruction of many German cities as he didn't want them to be occupied by Russians ... At the end Hitler is a big coward and commits suicide :X One of the must watch films ..... Another BEst non action film was Charlie Chaplin's "Great Dictator' ... :)

Author: 15 May 2005
Review: Very balanced for a film made by a Jew?
Review_Url: Seeing the name of the Director and guessing he may be Jewish i had very little hope this movie would be fair and balanced but within the first few minutes it shows that the Fuhrer had a fine sense of humour and i have never cried in a theatre but seeing the Fuhrer portrayed so beautifully was enough to make me shed a tear or two,When you see the Russian hoardes destroying the jewel of Civilisation which was Berlin at the time you find yourself wishing that those battle groups left really did unite and destroy the red menace!i can go on about the movies total accuracy to detail...hmm....the Tiger tank did look a little fake but hey!the ss uniforms were spot on and considering this didn't have the budget of a Spielberg jewlovefest the detail was brilliant1 anyway finally film makers are starting to show the Germans for what they were,human beings with issues like the rest of us,i think this film will mark the beginning of a humanising phase for the German side in war movies,its so wonderful to see the greatest military power that ever existed in a sympathetic light,one can only hope as the last of that generation die we can get balanced war movies showing brave ss men defending their land from rapist Russian troops,brilliant movie,if you love the Third Reich then watch this movie,it is a recruiting tool for the next generation,not since romper stomper have i seen so a near perfect movie!

Author: 17 April 2023
Review_Url: Honestly, I've never been blown away with a film like I was with this.

Author: 9 September 2005
Review_Url: There is one point I think, which is very important in this movie. The filmmakers worked very meticulous and show every cruelty of the last days in the bunker. But the only scenes they don't show are the death of Hitler and of Goebbels, they don't even show the corpses... That seems to be a glorification of Hitler and that should not be the intention of the movie...

Author: 23 April 2005
Review: Fly-on-the-wall recreation of the end of the Third Reich
Review_Url: Step inside the artillery-pounded, claustrophobic confines of Hitler's final command post. As German boys confront Russian tanks in the streets, leading Nazis and their generals are locked in a dance of death with their Fuhrer, who will not admit the reality of defeat and release them from disaster. Some try to save their own skins, others are unswervingly loyal. Most can only wait helplessly for events to unfold. A few heroes try to bring an end to the suffering. But gangs of villains use the dying days of the war to intensify it in an orgy of political violence.

Author: 20 April 2005
Review_Url: This extraordinary film presents in chilling detail the affect of the failure of Hitler's Third Reich. By keeping a close focus on Hitler's bunker and the government district of Berlin we can concentrate on who these people around him were and how they reacted to him and the imminent collapse of the Nazi dream.

Author: 26 September 2005
Review_Url: Having read most of the reputable books on Hitler's final days ie, Hugh Trevor Ropers "The Last Days of Hitler," "The Rise and Fall of the Third Reich" by William L. Shirer and "Inside the Third Reich" by Albert Speer to name a few, as well as majoring in History, I can attest that this film is THE most unbelievably accurate portrayal of the Third Reich's final days we are ever likely to see, and since most of the first hand observers are dead or in their final days it is very unlikely that any subsequent film will surpass this one. Time has a way of bending history to sway public opinion and suit current needs, and the more time passes, the more embellishments and subjective opinion can be inserted to distort true facts.

Author: 19 April 2006
Review_Url: Bruno Ganz is frighteningly brilliant, but the whole cast really takes you inside the insanity of Hitler's inner circle and makes it all too real. A must-see for students of 20th century European history. Incredible performances from the cast; a script that hews to actual events yet manages to boil down the drama to key moments. If anything the editors didn't leave enough on the cutting room floor but it's still a very tight film. The political courage to make this film also deserves some credit; Germany and the world are well served by a movie that shows the demonic charisma of one man and how so many are susceptible to that kind of power.

Author: 17 March 2021
Review: Probably the best German WW2 movie
Review_Url:
So criminally underated, so frightfully realistic.
With scenes that bring terror and tears to your eyes, Bruno Ganz makes you forget that he is an actor, makes you think that for 2 hours u really live under Hitler's commands.
A film that every person should definetly watch sometimes in his lifetime.

Author: 8 April 2018
Review_Url: Incredible film of the last days of Hitler and the people who stayed with him in the bunker as the Communists were closing in. Bruno Ganz's performance was spot on from the books written by/about those closest to him, especially his surviving secretary, Traudl Junge. Mr. Ganz vividly portrayed a manipulative monster, one who is very charming and warm when one-on-one with him, who loved dogs, children, and pretty secretaries, yet had a soul of evil that plotted and implemented the extermination of millions of innocent people and started a war that claimed tens of millions more. Christian Berkel is fascinating as the SS doctor trying to save the lives of as many people as he can from the Communist hoards sweeping in to Berlin. We know how this story ended, but now it was told honestly and factually.

Author: 14 October 2017
Review: Realistic look on Berlin's invasion from the other angle
Review_Url: Downfall projects emotions and tragedy involved while staying truthful and objective to the actual event it's depicting. It shows a wide variety of angles to the situation in a dark, realistic way. The practical effects, directing and outstanding performances make the story work when it so easily could have failed. It truly gives the feeling that people poured their heart and soul while making the film, because they believed that this specific depiction needed to exist. Which it does.

Author: 28 May 2018
Review_Url: If you don't like WW2 history or history in general, you won't enjoy this piece. But if you are a history enthusiast, this movie is a must-watch. It is purely amazing how acting is so realistic and you feel the tension in the bunker. The portrayal of Hitler is truly amazing, how people around him follow his orders, and how much of a madman he is, this movie shows it all.

Author: 5 April 2005
Review: The movie is about Hitler's last days in his bunker in Berlin!
Review_Url: This movie is one of the best war movies of all time. It shows the situation in the Fürherbunker in 1945 and the final days of Hitler. Bruno Ganz has the important role of ReichsFürher Adolf Hitler, and he does it greatly, he is excellent as Hitler! This movie is not only the best German film I have ever seen, but it is also the best movie over all that I have seen! There are many actors portraying all the people that were with Hitler in the Fürherbunker when he committed suicide, and all of those actors get the characters they are playing so really well. The movie is based mostly on the story of Hitler's secretary Traudl Junge. Finally Germans, you have done a movie to be proud of! Bravo!

Author: 24 February 2010
Review_Url: When I saw this film, I was very impressed by the role of Bruno Ganz playing Adolf Hitler. I think they're not many people who would like to play one of the most insane dictators of human history. But Bruno Ganz did a great job doing so. He played his role so convincing you might think Hitler was exactly like that. He was not just mad and insane all the time, but also showed human traits so now and then. To the end, the film becomes more and more dramatic and really gives you the feeling you are inside that bunker as an invisible spectator. You're experiencing the last desperate moments of Hitler and his military leaders finally resulting in their suicide. One of the scenes which struck me most, was the one in which Hitler thanked the Hitler-Jugend for their bravery and effort. I recently saw the original footage and it showed great accuracy and similarity with the film. Some believe this film is a tribute to the Nazis or a 'Hitler-glorification' which I myself fully disagree. This film simply shows the facts whether we like it or not but is at the same time very instructive.

Author: 31 May 2005
Review_Url: This is without doubt, one of the best and most important films ever created. Fully accurate, and filled with startling performances, it is simply one of the best films ever made. My only disappointment was the 15 certificate it received in the Uk. OK it was violent and grim, but this deserves to be seen by every man, woman and child, in fact it should be shown in History class at school. History come alive, and not in some dusty textbook. I left the cinema with a feeling stunned at what i had just seen, if ever there was a film to show the madness of Hitler and the absolute Armaggedon that National Socilaism brought to Germany, then this is it.

Author: 11 October 2005
Review: A history lesson to be watched
Review_Url: An outstanding movie. It was a little slow getting into it but ending up being a fast paced, action packed adventure into the mind of a mad man. Watching this movie and not knowing the history of Hitler and World War 2 you almost feel sorry for the guy. But to the families of the millions of people he ordered murdered, there is no sorrow for him. I found this movie very educational. It should be shown to high school students in all history classes. It starts by showing Hitler with a human side, then moves him to his delusional state that eventual shows him as a psychotic killer. The acting captured the mood when Hitler felt that his armies were coming to recapture Berlin and make everything right for, knowing very well that his armies were being defeated and there was no rescue. The way it was portrayed how Hitler turned on his biggest supporters when they realized all was lost and surrendered was bone chilling. His marriage to Eva Braun, a woman as nutty as he was, was also bone chilling on someone could love a man like Adolph Hitler. They both got what they deserve in the end although there still is doubt that they killed themselves and were burned. I still have beliefs that Hitler and Eva lived there lives out in Argentina, but I guess that story is for another movie. As long as you can stand the sub titles, I highly recommend this movie so that everyone can learn how this man nearly took over the world and maybe they will get an idea on how many other tyrants are out there is the modern world today.

Author: 11 March 2005
Review_Url: I just finished the movie at the moment and I think that I understand my anchestors better. Those who didn't believe Hitler lived in fear and those who believed had no sense for reality, where mislead or where on a pursuit for love, family and a better life without knowing what war really does. "Untergang" displayed psychopaths at it's best. Bruno Ganz (who played Goethes Faust in a 22 hour stageplay), one of the most variable actors of our time, played a perfect Hitler, as we know him from audio/visual documents. He even imitated his voice, walk and mimic frighteningly perfect. This movie is quite dangerous for less educated people, because it could be misunderstood. For all those guys there should be a fictitious sequel named "Hitler vs. Ghandi". And Ghandi finally wins. Of course he won before the struggle even begun ...people know why ... :-)

Author: 7 April 2005
Review: Cannot see what seems to be so compelling about Down Fall
Review_Url: Went to see Down Fall because I heard Bruno Ganz was worth seeing. He was worth seeing. But after the sixth or seventh of his scenes I found his role and his portrayal of Hitler uninteresting. The movie was not worth watching; though I suppose if you wanted a synopsis of what went on in the bunker the story covers a lot of ground. I left the theater after the sound of the shot. We are led to believe that Hitler has shot himself. Main gripes: Too long, Cheap looking locations, Too many characters (OK so there were a lot of people who wanted Hitler to surrender, to leave, to try and lessen the horror of Berlin's citizens) I couldn't see the purpose of recounting each one, This looked liked what it was; a made for TV movie. We get a glimpse of one viewpoint. The newly wed Eva Braun tries to suggest that maybe Hitler was of two distinct persona. The man versus the leader of the National Socialists. But that or any sort of real explanation for the different moods Ganz portrays are not developed.

Author: 31 July 2020
Review: Greatest war movie. Greatest movie ever quite possibly
Review_Url: Exceptional casting. Acting. Writing. Pacing. Everything one can think of to do with this just brilliant movie...

Author: 10 September 2005
Review_Url: This is the absolute most brilliant movie I have ever seen! See it! definitely! There is no excuse for not seeing it!It portrays Hitler's last days to perfection, if not historically (even though I believe it does, I'm not that in to history so I can't guarantee it)- than at least dramatically! You know when you go to see a movie and everybody just storms out the theatre as soon as the film is over? - This is the first time I've been to see a movie where everybody stayed in their seats till the lights where lit again! AMAZING, BREATHTAKING, SOOOO TOUCHING! This is fantastic! I know I use a lot of these: !, But believe me - This movie deserves it! See it! If not, you are really missing out.

Author: 17 March 2005

Author: 31 May 2013
Review_Url: Maybe even the best documentary movie. This movie, based on Traudl Junge's perspective(this makes the documentary better) makes Hitler less of a monster and more of a human being. He's become more caring than his real counterpart, the most notorious human being ever. I can see that he loves his dog and wife better than his real counterpart did. I might as well consider this Hitler to be very humane compared to the real Adolf Hitler. He can still be angry, quite so. But his anger is more fun to experience too. By the way, I may enjoy his anger.Many of the scenes are very well put together and notable. The movie has also given a lot of character to Nazis. They have lovable quirks and are useful in a pinch. This movie is a great documentary. I wonder if there are English captions. Then again, I enjoy this movie without the captions.

Author: 31 March 2005
Review: atypical war movie, why can't i support the people I'm watching?
Review_Url: *poilers if you don't know the ww2 story" one of the most amazing movies I have ever seen. Seeing through the enemies eyes, knowing things you don't read about in history books. I would not recommend this movie to anyone who does not know general facts about world war two, clearly meant for Germany a nation that realizes what it had done and has deep knowledge of the happening. If one does not know the evil of Hitler then the movie might stretch them to support him over an anonymous, ruthless opponent. This is not to say that the movie says Hitler is good, but it shows how ruthless of a leader he was without having to bring up the Jewish part of the holocaust. truly makes Hitler seem like an evil maniacal man obsessed and overcome with power.

Author: 9 March 2006
Review_Url: This is truly special in that there won't be a film better than it for a very long time. Bruno Ganz produces some legendary acting for the role of Hitler. Nobody could of done it better. The film shows Hitler in the lowest possible level although he is hated all over the world you begin to feel sorry for him because he is seen for what he truly is a human being. The characters in the film are also brought down to Hitlers level. The other become more desperate because they feel that Germany will crumble when isn't in power, they feel there is no future if Hitler doesn't rule over Germany. Ypu must see this film it will blow you away. Although the film is in subtitles but the film be as good if there wasn't any subtitles.*****

Author: 20 January 2006
Review_Url: I watched the first half of this film in cinema and went out. Normally I try to stay in the film even if it's bad, but I couldn't this time. They showed it in the free TV and I again tried to watch it. That was before a year or so and I'm still searching for the sense of this film. Well, I think I have to surrender. What's the sense to show the last hours of the worlds greatest tyrant who killed millions of human beings?? This film gives you the intention that the allies were the bad guys. What's the sense to make a film which intention obviously is to have pity on Adolf Hitler. So, what happened? Of course, children who don't know much about history yet feel sorry for him. I heard a little girl say: "Mum, why does everyone hate him? I think he's nice". I was close to puking when I heard that, but I couldn't accuse her. I would have thought of it the same way, when I was child.

Author: 2 March 2006
Review_Url: As a WWII history buff, I have seen numerous "Hitler's bunkers" flicks over the past 20 years growing up in Europe (and there are too many too list---American, Brit, German, and of course Soviet!) but this has to be by far the best adapted, most accurate versions of them all. One of the qualities that makes this historical gem stands out from the rest is its objective approach, presenting the nitty-gritty realities and chaos of WWII Berlin at the end of the war, portraying the Germans both as aggressors and victims with minimal politically-correctness "pins." Another exemplary feature of the film is its historical accuracy---from the war torn settings (bomb-out Reichchancellory, bunker, SS murdering rampages) to the relatively accurate plot to the authentic characters. Bruno Ganz's---had he been a Gringo, he'd have received Oscar nod for sure--- depiction of the Austrian "little corporal" (Hitler's generals reference to him behind his back) is the best I have seen to date, from Furher's megalomaniac mood swings to his delusions of grandeur and insidious evil magnetism. Beside the underlying psychological makeups of the characters, I particularly like the peripheral though informative elements of the film, such as images of widespread destructions of Berlin streets and the desperation of its inhabitants, the omnipresent terror and indiscriminant butchering of the innocents by Nazis zealots even as the "curtain falls." For a major motion pic, it did not spin or play to conventional beliefs as other big flicks have a tendency to do in order to appeal to mass consumption rather than historical accuracy. With a few exceptions, the movie follows many of the events surrounding Hitler circle quite accurately compared to other "insider" accounts (such as Traudl and Speer memoirs) of this fascinating history. There are a few historical divergences (i.e. most "bunker" flicks have the Goebbels asking one of the SS officers for help instead of doing it themselves at the end); however, these are minor lapses. Other than that, this realistic war drama will definitely be ranked along side other recent WWII treasures such as Schindler's List and Das Boot.

Author: 12 October 2006
Review: A wonderfully done piece of history noting the last days of Hitler
Review_Url: A very moving and at times disturbing account of Hitler and his cronies during the last days of the war. Especially riveting is the scene where Goebel's wife kills her own children. To see this dramatized is horrific. A must see movie. The movie I believe accurately portrays both the feeling of what happened and the psychology of what went on in these people's minds. This movie helped explain a few things about this time in period but also helped answer some questions I always had about the last days in Hitler's bunker. Make note that the very beginning of this movie has a brief clip of one of Hitler's secretaries before her death in 2002. It is her account and memoirs that helped make this movie. And to her I say thanks!

Review_Url:
Cast and plot, especially, it is based on true story.

Author: 7 May 2011
Review_Url: I became aware of this film through the many comedy videos on YouTube and wanted to see the whole film after seeing the great reviews it received. For many, The Nazi's are known as the scourge of the 20th century and while this film doesn't take any position on their actions, you actually find yourself feeling sorry for them, which is a first in my book and I would imagine others will derive the same sentiments from the film. The thing that brings on these feelings are the moments when the illusions of grandeur fall away for the characters and the realization that all they believed in is lost.

Review_Url: Being a student of WWII history and a fan of movies about that era, this movie caught me off guard. Sure it is about Adolf Hitler's last days in the bunker in Berlin. And that storyline is more compelling and honestly told than some of the other "bunker" moves starring A. Hopkins and A. Guiness.

Author: 19 January 2022
Review_Url: Hello! I have always liked historical films (based on real events - doubly!), and so, the German drama "Bunker" is just from this series! A huge request not to be confused with the Spanish film of the same name of the eleventh year! But I digress; So, in this film, the moments of the Second World War, which went down in history, will appear before the viewer's eye! Namely; - the moment of the greatest triumph of the Third Reich of the forty-second year, and then the inglorious end already in the forty-fifth year! In the cinema, we are used to the fact that the fascists are usually played by Baltic actors and Russians; here, it was the Germans who played the Fuhrer himself, Goebbels and others!

Review_Url: Bruno ganc is a briliant Actor whose Performance in this movie is out of this World. The Act of Hitler has never been put more to life.

Author: 25 March 2012
Review_Url: Bruno Ganz does an eerily convincing job of playing Hitler, during his last days, as visually narrated through the eyes of Traudl Junge. The pacing may be a little slow for some, although I felt it added to the palpable tension in the bunker. What I loved most about it is the gradual breakdown of several levels of human behavior. Their walls of confidence are shattered, their cocoons of denial slowly but surely pried open, their last glimmers of hope extinguished before their very eyes.

Author: 19 October 2006
Review: It's like you were there at the end
Review_Url: This is the most amazing movie about the final days of Hitler told from the perspective of his personal secretary. The madness of his regime comes through loud and clear. This is a "must see" for anyone who thinks one understands totalitarian or fanatical regimes or "the madness of crowds." Denial is a potent but essential drug of fanatics. One is impressed with Hitler's conviction and tenacity of his beliefs in his maniacal fantasies, delusional at the end. However, the madness continues. Compassion for the German people, who chose their leaders, is misplaced. They deserve what they get. Traitors are executed even though the war is nearly ended. Troops and officers get drunk, party with cocaine and alcohol, only to be arrested and shot just before the Russians overrun Berlin. Yet no one wants to live in a world without National Socialism. Clinging to the ideology to the end.

Author: 3 August 2005
Review: Not every Hitler or WO II movie is good or touching
Review_Url: The most boring movie ever! I was so sorry that I didn't leave the cinema during the break when I went to this movie. I was just waiting the whole movie for something interesting or amusing to happen, what never happened. Maybe a good moral or something could have made up for that, but that also was something the movie lacked. Plot line of the movie; a few bombs, a few sick and crazy Hitler fans, a bunch of people who didn't dare to speak up to Hitler and Hitler being boring and disturbed. Boring dialogs and even 'so-called-dramatic-events' came off pretty lame.

Author: 16 March 2005
Review_Url: GREAT movie with good actors....only Joseph Goebbels was played poor....the actor Willy Krause who played Joseph Goebbels in a movie from director Pabst "der letzte akt" was much much better. The cast are really great. These are mostly German stars, some not very famous, but they perform wonderfully. Bruno Ganz shows Hitler as he probably really was. The film is criticized because it gives the Nazi's a human face, but this is exactly it's strongest point the Nazi's were not extraterrestrial monsters, they were as human as you and I. It was very brave to make this film, given that controversy was almost certain to arise. One of the highlights of this year, to be sure. If you are interested in how it really was, go see it in the cinema, it's worth every penny.

Author: 12 September 2005
Review_Url: Downfall is one of the best World War II movies that I have ever seen. I like the fact that Downfall lets the viewer decide about the evilness of the characters by presenting them in a multi-dimensional manner. The way in which the characters are presented forces the viewer to analyze the motives and question themselves what others would do in a similar situation. The picture did an excellent job of showing the different types of followers, from the opportunistic, to those with a semblance of a conscience, to the blind devotee. Just an awesome portrayal of the conditions in Berlin at the war's end. The depth and complexity of the characters in the movie make this picture a must see for any movie lover.

Author: 24 August 2005
Review: a few hidden agendas among the ruins of the third Reich
Review_Url: A great movie: a superb vehicle for recounting the History of the end of Nazi Germany through the eyes of one of Hitler's secretaries, but take it with a few grains of salt. The producers described as History a number of THEORIES concerning the end of the Nazis. The doctor who mixed the knockout drug Finodin that Magda Goebbles gave to her children before killing them was named by the producers as Stumpfnegger, who committed suicide with Bormann. However, much evidence, including a deposition I have personally read in the US National Archives in College Park MD, names someone else (who denied involvement). Herman Fegelein is shown as having been arrested drunk in a hotel room (the Adlon?) and shot for desertion, though he was actually hanged for espionage, a much more involved and interesting albeit detracting story. Eva Braun, portrayed for the first time NOT as a cardboard character, when confronted with evidence of Fegelein's espionage, in fact supported the execution, but this was not portrayed. However, what the producers got right compensates for these nagging errors. A great touch was denying any lines to the evil debauched parasite Goering. Goebbles, Hasse, Shenk, Moenhke, Burgdorf, Krebs, and Weidling were portrayed masterfully. Even Bormann was portrayed as forgettable background furniture, a skilled ironic touch. The most successful technique: The set design often reproduced in exacting detail famous stills taken during the fall of Berlin. I often caught myself thinking, "I remember that," though I was never there.

Author: 17 May 2005
Review: The Downfall is the movie itself!
Review_Url: I saw this film in Germany with some German friends when it first released. We all had to hold ourselves back from leaving early from the film. We only decided to stay to see if there was a great ending, but no. The acting was so terrible. I mean just awful and my German friends couldn't agree more. There were random scenes that had nothing to do with the film and they were boring too, which just added to the length of this nightmare. I was surfing through IMDb and came across the ratings and comments for this movie and couldn't believe how highly this film was voted. I immediately called my German friend who was dumbfounded as well. Someone even wrote that this was the best World War II film ever made! Give me a break. Saving Private Ryan will sweep mops the floor with Der Untergang. Don't waste your time or money on this film.

Author: 28 August 2005
Review: The End of a true life horror of dictation
Review_Url: DOWNFALL is very well produced, and is truly the depiction behind the secretary of the greatest feared dictator in the 20th century. This film is graphic and surreal in its ability to depict the awful dilemma that faced the German people as they plead their allegiance to the 3rd Reich, and faced the loss of their own personal lives for the sake of it's leader. This film also show the believed nature and psyche of Adolf Hitler and his lack to care even for his own followers. The film shows the tragedies of the results that ended the Germans in their battle of WWII. The film is harsh in its graphics, and yet real to show the hazards of allegiance to a mentally unhealthy ruler. A great film to depict another view of our world history in WWII. A film that can also teach lessons for people now to consider the gravity involved in following a group not allowing compromise in its position.

Author: 27 June 2019
Review_Url: The film was beautiful, but some of the facts were changing and some issues were pointed out.

Author: 3 March 2006
Review_Url: I have to say I was surprised when I realised this was in German, so used to films being in English these days...it makes a refreshing change. With the film being in subtitled German it gave it an air of authenticity (as far as a film documentary can be) that I enjoyed. Yes, it humanised Hitler and those around him but on the flip side it made the situation they were in and the things they did in their final hour all the more horrifying, particularly the systematic killing of the goebbels children by their own mother. In all a great film for those who are interested in WW2 history I'd give it a 9 but for Everyone Else it's a 8 or possibly a 7 since it did drag, even for me, in places.

Author: 20 February 2006
Review: Excellent movie, but supporting characters seemed to be merely sketches.
Review_Url: I first saw Downfall at an art house in Scottsdale. Wanting to be able to see it without the usual American movie accompaniment of gallon buckets of soda and garbage can-sized popcorn, I opted for the early, midday show. To my amazement, the place was packed! Still, to their credit, they were a very quiet and appreciative audience. The movie itself was brilliant, although the supporting cast bore no resemblance to the originals. Joseph Goebbels was small, and was known as the 'Poison Dwarf', but was played by a very tall German actor. Now, to my beef. I'm a writer (2 novels, 1 non-fiction book, many magazine articles), and I'm looking for information on Herman Fegelein, the Waffen-SS general who was married to Gretl Braun, Eva's sister. He was shot in the garden outside the bunker. I'd like to have seen more of this character, especially as he was seen in his apartment getting ready to leave town! Maybe if a 'director's cut' DVD is going to be released, we'll see more of this character.

Author: 30 June 2013
Review_Url: This is the greatest WW2/Hitler based movie I have ever seen. Bruno Ganz is excellent as Adolf Hitler. In fact all the cast are great and so believable in their parts. I was completely taken in by the story and found the retelling of Hitler's final days enthralling. The fact that it was subtitled was a thought that annoyed me before I sat down to watch this masterpiece. However shortly into the movie I had almost forgotten they were there and regretted not giving this piece a chance sooner. I was glued to the screen all the way through. If only more movies were made as great as this one, with less Hollywood and more realistic feel.

Author: 23 January 2012
Review: An Extraordinary View of the Final Days of a Madman
Review_Url: Oliver Hirchbiegel's Downfall (Der Untergang) offers a spectacular view at the final days of one of history's most notorious madmen. Based on the accounts of Hitler's secretary Traudl Junge, Downfall unflinchingly depicts the end of the Nazi leader's life prior to the German surrender during World War II. Lead actor Bruno Ganz is easily the highlight of the film—he manages to be both captivating and frightening in his portrayal of a desperate Adolf Hitler. The rest of the cast performs admirably as well. They really draw you into the events of the film with universally believable performances.

Author: 19 February 2012
Review: As Good As It Gets - Astonishingly good!
Review_Url: I love history and at times get disheartened when a director loose touch at what they are trying to achieve. In this case to tell an accurate account of Hitler and his closest comrades.

Author: 22 March 2012
Review_Url: Der Untergang, or The Downnfall, was a very well scripted and depicted movie about the events that took place in Hitler's Berlin Bunker. The story is made better by the perspective from which it is told. It is about a young lady who becomes Hitler's secretary and how she views the events in the final days of the Third Reich. It is a very compelling and emotional movie but is not for the faint of heart as the movie can be graphic at times but aside from the grotesque scenes, the movie is fantastic.

Author: 17 February 2006
Review_Url: Nobody knows what exactly happened in Berlin in 1945; this is fiction. The documentary stance is better than for example Hollywood's interpretation of Hiroshima & Nagasaki. One must always look at a movie in terms of profit-driven intent. No movie is a true documentary. European movies and all other industries have been suffering since 1945, and they will continue to do so for another 100 years or so... Except Great Britain and Switzerland, of course (they are shareholders in Hollywood media). We do not care about Monaco or Luxembourg, for now. When will there be real freedom of the press (the press includes international movie distribution). What if someone will make a movie that will show WW1 & WW2 from another point of view, and he or she will publicize it as fiction? That would have to be upheld as constitutional in a supreme court within the EU (let us not deal with the corruption of US courts that is, at least for now, is not substantial in the EU, but it shall come shortly). So, in our view, history books published after 1945 are propaganda, nothing more, nothing less.

Author: 15 April 2005
Review_Url: This is very beautiful movie, especially if you had the chance to see the movie/interview with Traudl Junge and also had a chance to familiarize yourself with the story of Sophie Scholl, her brother and a group of young Germans executed in 1942, the year the film begins. The White Rose is a movie about them. The downfall is captivating, showing how human beings can become so entangled in ideology that will make them do things you would never think of doing in your right mind. But how horrible it must have been for Bruno Ganz to decide to play Hitler! Yes, the National-socialists are all human beings, showing them as alien monsters does not help understanding how WWII and the concentration camps came about...

Author: 12 March 2005
Review_Url: This is one of the finest renditions I have ever seen of the other side of World War II; and everything in it is very accurate, I was surprised by how the filmmakers did not shy away from some of the more powerful moments, such as Magda Goebbels poisoning her children, or Hitler testing the poison on Blondi. All that DID happen, and Hitler really was that erratic in the Bunker; read the standard books on the subject,and you'll find that this Hitler's performance matches exactly that of the real one who committed suicide in 1945.

Author: 3 April 2005
Review_Url: I have seen a number of similar films over the years and sat down to view this new film with the first thought that it would be the same plot with different, unknown to me, actors and actresses.

Author: 19 April 2005
Review_Url: Being a history student and someone who has read a lot about WWII, this movie struck be as being very accurate. I think Ganz's depiction of Hitler is quick remarkable. Portraying the definition of evil while at the same time showing other emotions must have been quite a challenge. The directors choice of someone 10 years older than Hitler was at the time was also interesting. Also, both the Goebbles were chilling P.S. I did not find that the Nazi's were in anyway glorified or justified. The fact he did not give them horns or a pitch-fork tail does not lessen the message that Hirschbiegel wanted to deliver. The Nazi's were human, and they came from human conditions.

Author: 26 April 2005
Review: Did you feel emotional after viewing 'the passion of the Christ'? if you did then you may experience a similar experience after watching downfall 1
Review_Url: In my opinion 'Downfall' visually complements two books I have read on the last days of the 'Third Reich'. The authors being Joachim Fest and Albert Spier. As far as I recall, all details in the film are same as the descriptions contained within the books from the authors, in other words the film conforms to the accuracies portrayed in the books. The film portrays the last days of Hitler and his confidantes, who retreated to the Berlin 'bunker'to avoid shelling from the Red Army. The film manages to capture within the bunker the bleakness, the hellhole, and the madness that much of the Nazi topbrass experienced toward the end. If you know your WWII history and the enigma of Hitler, his idealism, his imperialistic ambitions then you will be able to sense the absolute madness and emotions he and his entourage people were feeling. What is that old saying .....'the higher you fly the harder you fall' ? Compelling

Author: 27 December 2005
Review_Url: Honestly I have to say that this is the 1st movie I ever say to summarize Hitler's last days. I know that there are several movies like The Bunker for Anthony Hopkins but I never saw that. The movie was so realistic as If your living really the last few days with Hitler's and his men on their Bunker. Alexandra Maria Lara (as Traudl Junge) was so attractive and did a perfect performance as Hitler's secretary! if you are interested on knowing more about this you can check out the Documentary Blind Spot - Hitler's Secretary which is well informative. Also Bruno Ganz (as Hitler) adopted Hitler's character as if he was Hitler!! you cant believe this until you see some documentaries about Hitler's era. This movie is really one of the best foreign movies I ever saw and and no wonder it was nominated for an Oscar as the best foreign movie. I heard also that this is the 1st German movie regarding Hitler and the end of the Third Reich. weired! what they were waiting for!

Author: 30 August 2005
Review: Probably the best movie I've seen the last 10 years
Review_Url: Probably the best movie I've seen the last 10 years. The casting is superb, the acting is honest and shaking. Take into considering that the movie is German, touching deep into national soul and regret. The storyteller (a young personal secretary for Adoph Hitler) is probably not always the best witness seen from a historical point of view and some scenes therefore not exact documentally (i.e. partly fiction) such as the Mrs. Göring killing of her own children - in fact one of the most shaking parts. The fall of Hitler as a person is portrayed with excellent force. See the film. It is worth it - but see it in a theater with a large screen. It deserves it.

Author: 3 January 2006

This movie is excellent is like a classic film

Author: 22 March 2006
Review_Url: This film is the most powerful I have ever seen, a compelling vision of an episode in history that has always fascinated me. Adolf Hitler (supremely realised by Bruno Ganz), the archetype of evil, liberated from stereotype, is made human, sympathetic even. Stripped of his diabolic rhetoric from the podium, he becomes an introspective shadow of his former self, moving from incandescent rage to utter despair, vainly clutching to a delusional hope of final victory. Downfall also has a surrealistic element. Utterly despondent people whose Dream literally crumbles around them are seen partying with the Red Army knocking at the door. Innocent children, oblivious to their bleak future, sweetly serenade their elders in the claustrophobic bunker. For me, this is as close a vision of hell that has ever been committed to film, as Hitler's secretary Traudl Junge says, "It's like a dream but I can't wake up.

Author: 19 March 2006
Review_Url: well i got the DVD of it and i like to see it its a very precise movie and detailed,not exaggerating on the content and showing pretty much what happened by then supported on basis by the testimonials and notes
